bioghist.p: Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule, III (b. 1925) was curator of classical art at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, from 1957 to 1996. He completed his bachelor's degree at Harvard in 1947 and his master's in 1951 under George M.A. Hanfmann. He earned his Ph.D. at the University of London (1953). From 1953 to 1955 he taught fine arts at the University of Michigan. He then served as Assistant Professor of Classical Archaeology at Bryn Mawr College until 1957, when was appointed curator of classical collections for the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. He assumed the directorship of the museum in the 1970s.

scopecontent.p: The papers in this collection date from the mid-1950s, when Vermeule was a faculty member at Bryn Mawr College. Materials include notes on antiquities in British collections, manuscripts by Vermeule and others, correspondence,and course materials for classes in archaeology and Greek and Roman art that Vermeule taught at Bryn Mawr and the University of Michigan.
